top_comments.comment: Sorry, but Emily's painting looked like something a preschooler produced and she moved at a snails pace. I did like the other two shortlisted pieces and how both focused on completely different aspects of the landscape. Made it hard to choose between them but I liked that Tom won. I felt his piece represented the overall landscape better.
"Titivating" is the word of the day.  To make small, enhancing alterations.  Well done, everyone.
By far, the best painting of he day was the young lady who won the wolf card. Eager to see how she does next time

comments_since_last_sample.body: Why don’t we see an artist representing the wildcards in the semis?
Why ya fuckin lettuce like that tho?? harry potter ass
Tom looks just like the artist who won in the previous season, Richard Alan, they could be brothers.

Sorry, but Emily's painting looked like something a preschooler produced and she moved at a snails pace. I did like the other two shortlisted pieces and how both focused on completely different aspects of the landscape. Made it hard to choose between them but I liked that Tom won. I felt his piece represented the overall landscape better.
By far, the best painting of he day was the young lady who won the wolf card. Eager to see how she does next time
"Titivating" is the word of the day.  To make small, enhancing alterations.  Well done, everyone.
